definition: to pour out (emotions)/to unburden oneself (of strong feelings)/to vomit comprehensively
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to pour out (emotions)/to pour one's heart out/to say everything that is on one's mind

sentences.english: The act of vocally expressing our troubles to a trusted friend can offer instant stress-reduction.
sentences.chinese: 和值得信賴的朋友傾吐自己的煩惱可以減輕壓力。

sentences.english: She confided her troubles to a friend.
sentences.chinese: 她向朋友傾吐了內心的煩惱。

sentences.english: He confided his innermost secrets to her.
sentences.chinese: 他向她傾吐了內心深處的祕密。

sentences.english: The mouth of the virtuous utters wisdom and his tongue speaks of what is right.
sentences.chinese: 義人的口傾吐智慧，他的舌頭講論公義。

sentences.english: She poured out her worries to the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她向醫生傾吐出自己的憂愁。

sentences.english: Jone felt she could only confide in her mother.
sentences.chinese: 瓊覺得她只有向她媽媽傾吐心中的祕密。

sentences.english: He breathed words of love into her ear.
sentences.chinese: 他輕聲在她耳畔傾吐愛戀之言。

sentences.english: I'd only met him once, and here he was, pouring out his heart to me。
sentences.chinese: 我只跟他見過一次面，但他已經在向我傾吐心事了。

sentences.english: I unloaded all my troubles on him.
sentences.chinese: 我向他傾吐我的種種煩惱。

sentences.english: She confided all her secrets to her best friend.
sentences.chinese: 她向她最好的朋友傾吐了所有的祕密。

sentences.english: To Jo alone did the shy girl tell her thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 這個羞怯的小姑娘只背對裘一個人傾吐自己的心曲。

sentences.english: So put your pen to paper and pour your feelings out for the love of your life.
sentences.chinese: 所以，拿起筆，傾吐你對至愛的情意吧。

sentences.english: Sure, you can unload your problems on your Pisces friend.
sentences.chinese: 當然，你可以對你的雙魚座朋友傾吐你的煩惱。

definition: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
not a sound to be heard (idiom)
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
